Reviews.Title: “we just used the mineral pools”
Reviews.Author: Dinara G
Reviews.Content: We just used the mineral pools and payed 25$ for a day pass for each person.We stayed in Pink Mansion which is clean and excellent B&B with indoor pool and garden hot tub. I saw the pictures of the rooms and thought that it would be nice to stay somewhere with nice rooms and use pools for the fee of Calistoga Spa Hot Spring. The pools are wonderful, the water is clean, the pools have different temperatures, so you can choose whichever you like and there is a small pool for the children. Minus: Construction noise- I would make a discount for that fact, I would pay 15$ for day pass. And of course I don't want to stay in this Inn since the rooms do look like a motel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Sparkling clean water is the key”
Reviews.Author: TravelLightOften
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights here on a recent rainy weekend. The main attractions are the 104 degree soaking pool (over 16 years only; another warm pool for kids) and an outstanding 80 degree lap pool. The outdated (think 1980's) but immaculate 2nd floor unit had a comfortable king bed, large glued-down pink lamps, a small flatscreen TV & kitchen which was well stocked with pots, utensils, plates, etc; a cooktop; a toaster; but amazingly, no microwave! If you love your coffee, forget the tiny coffeemaker in the room and walk over to the Calistoga Roastery for excellent brew & pastries. Internet was good. Bathroom had big shower with 2 shower heads, rail, and bench. Family atmosphere here, better than average excercise room. You can walk to a number of restaurants, a cool little museum, and there's a store a block away for groceries. We heard that the rooms are slated to be revamped soon, no date mentioned. The room price was steep, but the wonderfully maintained pools made it worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “"Relaxing Spring Break"”
Reviews.Author: Lisa W
Reviews.Content: My mom and I and my three children (ages 12, 9, 5) had a wonderful time at Calistoga Spa Hot Springs! I didn't want to go home! The rooms were clean and cozy and had a small kitchen which was so convenient with the kids. I would make breakfast and lunch in our room which left us more time to swim and relax in their three mineral pools and large hot tub. The staff was so pleasant and helpful. I got an hour long massage which was amazing! The spa area was clean and comfortable and I couldn't of been happier. I would relax after dinner by the beautiful outside fire pit as my kids had their last swim of the night and I treated them to an ice cream at the poolside snack bar which was stocked with their favorites! We all just loved staying at Calistoga Hot Springs and we plan on making this one of our vacation destinations. So enjoyable, fun, and relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “Calistoga Spa Hot Springs is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: debbilovewine
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Calistoga Spa Hot Springs for about 20 years now and I have never been disappointed. It started as a day trip-ONCE-then a wedding shower-ONCE-then every Mother's Day weekend with a group of gals and family weekend trips-now it's a get-away for me and my husband. The staff is wonderful, the pools delightful, spa services relaxing, rooms are great and I love the bbqs. We will be spending our anniversary there this year. We are looking forward to another great weekend. Don't forget your Noodle for the pool. I can't wait to see the remodeled pools and fire pit.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday at Calistoga”
Reviews.Author: Infrequenttraveler07
Reviews.Content: Have spent many birthdays at this place. Wonderful sort of down home type of establishment. I think all rooms have a kitchen and easy access to the hot tubs and pools. There is a two night minimum on weekends but I just asked for one room for one night this Sat (we are already getting two other rooms) and it was agreed to quickly. I like how accommodating the staff is for special occasions. Last year they let us know of a deal they were offering (a Passport) that saved us money and added to our weekend pleasure without even knowing about it beforehand. Some may think January is a weird time to spend in Calistoga but we love the steam and fog and early evenings spent in the hot tubs. Love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Best outdoor spa for day use in the wine country - newly renovated!”
Reviews.Author: merylemishkin
Reviews.Content: I have been going to this outdoor spa for years, and it just keeps getting better. I am not terribly familiar with the rooms, although they are probably nice enough, but I usually just go for day use since we live not too far away. It is like a little country club with mineral pools and spa services, and a gym. Get there early on popular days, and enjoy the tubs and pools until 9pm. They just renovated (completed December 2011), and it looks better than ever - all the tiling looks beautiful and tastefully done. They added a gorgeous fire pit, beautiful indirect lighting, and it looks like they are planning to add some outdoor canopied beds if I am not mistaken. Bring a picnic, or walk one block to get to downtown Calistoga and buy a picnic lunch and bring it back (there is even a winetasting place within a block). They allow you to bring food and drinks (alcoholic too!) to enjoy at the tables that surround the pools. This place is not only great, but kid-friendly. There is a large gazeboed hot tub which is adults only, but they have a kids warm pool under a waterfall, and the lanes pool and other hot pool are open to kids (they even allow flotation devices). Oh, did I mention that on January 1st when we went, it was 70 degrees out and sunny? Little slice of heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Aging; Improvements Coming?”
Reviews.Author: lildvm
Reviews.Content: My BF And I stayed here on a drive trip. It's a lovely spot and the hot spring soaking spas are fabulous. Wish we'd had a chance to sample some of their other spa amenities, this would be a very nice destination resort. Unfortunately there was serious remodeling going on while we were there, involving the swimming pool (closed) and the sidewalk leading to our room. I think this bodes well for the near future but made for an awkward traverse to our room, which happened to be the single most distant from both parking lot and lobby - down the overgrown sidewalk, up the stairs, around a bend and down another walkway. The room was pretty quiet but the mattress was old, thin and uncomfortable. My BF chatted with the recently-hired manager and it sounds like better mattresses are on the short list so we may go back.

Reviews.Title: “Super relaxing pools!”
Reviews.Author: Joan88
Reviews.Content: Inspite of the work on the lap pool and kiddie pool, the just redone pools were quite lovely and especially beautiful and quiet at night. Rooms are fine...clean and aside from the skimpy pillows and blankets, quite adequate. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: christso
Reviews.Content: Calistoga Spa Hot Springs is clean, relatively quiet, and had an attentive staff. The spa pools were good and location is walking distance to downtown. I used the workout room early mornings and it was empty. I would go back no problem.

Reviews.Title: “I have enjoyed this spa for over 20 years”
Reviews.Author: marilynnadler
Reviews.Content: This spa has an older well used aspect, so is not decorated with the very latest or newest furniture. But that also has advantages, because windows open and everything is handy. There are good lamps and the right amount of furniture. I like comfort and function above the ultra frou frou look. The kitchen is really useable also, but if one were staying longer, it might be nice to bring a blender or toaster. There are so many good restaurants, who wants to cook full meals? However, the ground floor rooms look out on a very nice patio area with picnic tables and grills. Many people barbeque here. They also have handy bike racks, but you have to bring your own bike. They can be rented on the main street. This is another great thing about the spa, it is one block from the main street of Calistoga and from a lovely bike path. The service could be better. I asked for late check-out of 12:00 and I called at 8:30 a.m. The desk person said all the late checkouts had been given out. ???? Calling the night before they say to call in the a.m. I noticed a huge number of people leaving early, so it seemed to me they are not being accommodating. Furthermore, the check in time is at 3 p.m. I wish we could get a law passed that specifies a hotel, spa or motel must give a customer 24 hours of time. As it stands, the check-in is at 3 and the check out is at 11:00. We went at the height of the season so expected to pay a good price, but this spa keeps raising their rates, so that it was really approaching $200 per night for 2 of us and a 12 year old. They have 3 pools and a large very hot pool that I never use. I like a pool around 90 degrees and only the kiddy pool is this temperature. Pools are 104, 100, and 80 respectively. The 80 degree pool is very comfortable when it is really hot, which it was in the afternoon. But for me in the a.m. and p.m. when the temperature outside dropped to maybe 60, the 80 degree pool is too cold. But the 100 degree pool is too hot to swim.. Oh well, I will continue to go back, but I really hope their service improves.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the pools...”
Reviews.Author: Lionheart69
Reviews.Content: ... so don't go there for the gym, the room or the service or with any intention of going anywhere else during the day. The rooms are very 80's and motel like but clean. The pools are some of the cleanest I've seen and I resented leaving them to go anywhere else during the day. I think the rooms are over due a refurb and the hotel is too expensive for something that is seriously need of updating but its probably perfect for a family holiday or reunion rather than a romantic one. The staff aren't the best trained but are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the pools”
Reviews.Author: familytraveller-E
Reviews.Content: The property is definitely older but as mentioned in other posts kept very clean. It is convenient to have the full size frig in the rooms and some ability to cook but there are no microwaves. We liked the pools and even though it was warm in the day times, we spent quite a bit of time in the warmer pools. We were travelling with an infant and were able to get a crib for the room. My only complaint is that we were switched from a king bed room to a room with two doubles (or queens) instead. We did pay almost as much for this room as we did for a four-star hotel on Union Square in San Francisco, which seemed high. But, it is Napa Valley and I guess that is to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for what it is”
Reviews.Author: TakeTheTemperature
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small and have relatively old furniture and appliances. The gym facility is completely outdated. The mud bath was great but the one hour massage left much to be desired (not worth $100 by a long shot). My husband burned his foot in the steam room and when he mentioned it to staff, they said "Yeah, that's happened to a couple of people". Well, if that's happened to more than one person, they should fix it, no? Dr. Wilkenson's across the street has a similar mud bath treatment and a much much better massage. The pools were very enjoyable but at times kind of crowded. Room service is marginal. They just do your bed and change the towels. They did not do our dishes (the few that there were) nor did they really clean the shower. The day we were leaving there was no hot water (although we did get a small discount for this). I think the best thing about this place are the pools and the fact that they are kid friendly. However, for $200 a night, which is what it comes out to be with all the taxes and tourist fees, it is completely not worth it. If the rooms were around $120-150, then yes, I might consider coming back. Speaking of which, I though the rooms would be around $150 a night but because it was a holiday week (a few days before and New Year's eve), it turned out to be much more expensive. They really should advertise holiday prices on their website so that people know what they are going to pay. The total bill was a bit of a surprise and left a bad taste in my mouth. That did not need to happen if only the website would say ..."New Year's week = $184 per night".

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel and meeting room for a family reunion!”
Reviews.Author: CRUZGALMCO
Reviews.Content: The staff was excellent. The kitchenettes and barbeque/picnic areas were excellent. Everyone had their own favorite pool. Mine was the kiddie pool-spent hours with my grandson. Great location one block off main street and walking distance to market & dining. I recommend a trip to the Castillo di Amorossa. We loved the Napa Valley Wine Train gourmet express dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are dated, but Hot Spring Pools are fantastic & make this worth the while!”
Reviews.Author: Robi0304
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on a trip mixing relaxation and wine. The rooms were quite dated. I noted a number of stains throughout. But the small kitchenette was nice, and they had some of the softest bath towels I've ever encountered in any hotel. Needless to say, we spent very little time in the room and all the time we could out in the spa pools. These pools were fantastic! I can't say I've ever spent more than 30 minutes in a hotel pool as an adult, but we spent hours moving between the three in the evenings. There were also outside tables and grills available for guests. These were great as our first night we passed on going out to eat and just picniced on the patio instead. The staff - especially those out by the pools - were extremely nice and very helpful. All in all it was an extremely good experience and I would highly consider coming back. There is a great coffee shop a block away from the hotel, and the supermarket is probably a block and a half away. It was the perfect location and a great find.

Reviews.Title: “We didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: SFgal40
Reviews.Content: This was our second holiday weekend staying here with our 3 year-old, and we felt lucky we actually got a room off the waiting list. Last Labor Day, we stayed here for three nights, and this time, just for two. It's hard to describe this hotel, and though there are things to complain about, we were totally blissed out the whole time we were there. Part of it was the lovely hot weather and all the festivities going on for the Fourth in Calistoga, an adorable town that we love more every time we visit. The hotel is perfectly located for exploring the main street and a 10 or 15-minute walk to the county fairgrounds where we went to a magical old-fashioned carnival. But back to the hotel--the rooms are very dated, and the beds a bit hard and yes the pillows are flat and they're aren't enough of them. They don't provide wine glasses (it's Napa Valley, hello), and they are stingy with pool towels. You can never use the grills because other guests claim them at 8am by putting bags of charcoal on them and basically claiming entire areas. Granted, we've only stayed here on major holiday weekends--it can't be this bad all the time. We were irked by many little things, but the pools, the landscaping, the general ambiance of the place, makes us feel right at home, and we love watching our daughter go back and forth between the kiddie pool and the big pool like she owns the place. We had to fight to get a table (the guests there have an annoying tendency to completely take over every available chair and lounger for the whole day, even if they don't show up until 2 or 3pm, and that was frustrating, but still, we always found a spot, and loved going back and forth to the room, to the hot pools at night, to town for breakfast. We could even see the fireworks from the parking lot. So, with all of these annoyances why do i love this place so much? I can't really say--but we are already planning to go back. If you have kids, it's a great place, the best in town, because it's family-friendly. Don't expect pampering or really nice rooms. But, it's a decent enough bargain in a great town, and the mineral pools really do make you feel good.

Reviews.Title: “A remodel is long over due!”
Reviews.Author: RSkier05
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times over the years. The pools have been the only reason we have kept coming back, they are great. The rooms are long over due for a serious remodel. The beds are very hard, as are the pillows. It was two nights of fighting to sleep. The hotel decor is late 70's, ugly. There is a base board heater in the room, that is so noisy that you would almost just rather be cold then have it wake you up every time it turns on. We will not be back, unless they change things.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: marysi
Reviews.Content: We visited the spa for a quick trip while we were in California and stayed here unfortunately!! The accommodations were margionally passable but the staff was very unpleasant and rude. When we expressed our concerns, Doug the manager, was mildly concerned and was more interested in how busy he was to help. We will not be back !!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy; it's about the pools.”
Reviews.Author: MrsPeekaboo
Reviews.Content: I love this place. People need to realize that what they call a "spa" - the scented everything, the soft lighting, the expensve "custom" products... those are just add-ons to the basics - mineral water, massage, mudbath... That's what you'll find here. Mineral water - three pools' worth (and a baby pool) - massage (very good ones), and mudbaths (don't come to Calistoga and not have a mudbath!). Staying here, you have all day access to all the pools, so you can nap and soak and nap and soak. Very nice. Rooms are pretty basic, but have TV and internet. Could use a few more pillows, and mattresses are pretty unspectacular - quite firm. Since the rooms are kitchenettes, you can also make your own breakfast and lunch and whatever and save a bundle. I've been coming to Calistoga and staying here a couple times a year for probably 20 years or more. I always schedule at least one mudbath and a massage. I have learned the best time is during the week, check in on a Monday and check out on a Thursday or Friday. Look around on a crowded weekend and you'll see every "rule" being violated, from "no cell phones in pool area" to "no children under 14 in the hot pool" to "barbecues for hotel guests only". So if you're coming to relax, don't come on a weekend. Too many doting parents ignoring their kids' obnoxious behaviors; people up late and having wine-soaked, maudlin discussions on the patios that waft into your open windows. During the week, esp. off season, it's mellow. After the public hours end (around 9p, I think), it's wonderful to go take some wine down to the pools and look at the stars. There's a great grocery across the street, and plenty of good restaurants on the main drag or nearby. Lots of Russians and other eastern europeans around during the week - which can be interesting, they're usually pretty nice and fun to talk with. Again, it's nothing fancy, offers the basics, a nice staff... you can visit day spas in town for more upscale products and atmosphere, but I think you're missing what Calistoga - beautiful, down-to-earth, funky, time-warped Calistoga - is all about. Taking the waters!

Reviews.Title: “bad just plain bad”
Reviews.Author: blughe
Reviews.Content: the only nice thing i can say for the hotel is they had great maids. $500 = 2 night 2 robes i would have rater stayed home. I left this spa to go straight to my local spa to relax from having to be here. try anywhere elese motel 6 is nicer

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: mrkitty3
Reviews.Content: We have been customers of the Calistoga Spa for over 5 years. Often we come for the day but the past two years we have stayed for a few nights. The rooms are very basic and "look" affordable but the pricing scheme is sneaky...read the fine print especially if traveling with young children and especially if you've reserved 2 queens, the family unit, or the suite. Bottom line is that I was overcharged in a very misleading manner and when I took this up with management they were unwilling to do anything about it. The service was the worst I have ever received from any business that I have ever dealt with...no joke. One of the employees even threatened to call the police on my family and I. When I spoke to the manager about the treatment I received from the employee, she replied that she would "talk to her about it." Not exactly the response I was looking for. I will say that the pools are great, especially for young kids however, for the price we ended up being charged we could've rented an oceanfront beach house (seriously, I looked into it). I am heartbroken that one of our favorite places has become such a horrible disappointment. We will not be going back, nor will we be recommending the Calistoga Spa to any of our friends. Just the thought of dealing with the staff and management makes me cringe. With so many other great spas in Calistoga, I would choose another place to stay if I were a new comer.

Reviews.Title: “just okay”
Reviews.Author: standswithsuitcase
Reviews.Content: My bf and I went here for a mid-week R&R. I think we were both a little taken aback, because the "resort" looks very little like the photos, and more like an early seventies Hotel 8. No grounds or garden to speak of, just basically a parking lot and then a fenced-off pool area. We got there around 5pm, ck in is after 3pm, and the "spa" was already closed, so we couldn't use the steam room, or get any kind of spa treatment. They have four pools outside. Only one was actually really hot enough to feel therapeutic. All the pools were rather crowded with other people. We were looking for a more romantic, pampering experience, and that is not what you get here. It's no frills, and a clean room. Because they also allow "day guests" I would imagine it gets quite crowded during the busy season. We paid about $130 for one night. We will definitely go to Calistoga again, but will look for a more lux place, that is truly a spa. If you have kids, or are looking for something very basic, this is probably an okay place. It was clean, service was polite, and the location is centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite budget-saver in Calistoga!”
Reviews.Author: jenngg
Reviews.Content: Visiting Calistoga is a family tradition going back three generations. Staying at the Calistoga Spa Hot Springs is my generation's favorite place to stay. It's one of the most affordable spots in an expensive town and area and has kitchenettes to save further on breakfast and lunch costs. Put what you saved towards a great dinner and spa treatments! Make no mistake, the Four Seasons this is not. The rooms are clean but spartan - if you want tons of fluffy pillows, bring them from home. The pools are the best in town - and trust me, I've swam in each and every one of them. There are water temperatures for every member of the family, including small children and a hot tub for the grown ups. This is a wonderful, family-friendly motel. In terms of spa treatments, this is ok, If you can spend more, go to Indian Springs right down Lincoln. The mud baths there are the best (pure volcanic ash with no peat moss), and you get to use the olympic-sized hot springs pool for the day as well.

Reviews.Title: “Just for the pools!”
Reviews.Author: Napamisfit
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to the Calistoga spa since I was a child. My kids and now my grandchildren have made the yearly visit, I'm talking over 30 years now. I remember staying here before and after they remodeled the place, added the suite and 2 new pools. We stayed during the noisy construction. Now...it takes a minimum of 2 months to get a reservation. The staff is not particularly friendly and you get the feeling that your business does not matter. We come because of the pools only. The only room worth staying in is the suite above the office, if you can get it. They don't allow children there however. To simply come and lay by the pool has gone from, $6.00 a day to 35.00. Can you believe that? I guess they want to discourage the day visitors but, living as close as I do, I would often come up for the day. The cost is now prohibitive even if affordable. It's a matter of principle. Anyway, enjoy the pools...tolerate the rest. Indian Springs has really upped the experience there. You might want to give it a try. They have one huge pool and it is quite enjoyable as well.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: sanman3113
Reviews.Content: What a horrible experience. Not only were the grounds dirty but the room itself was a mess- only 2 flat pillows, dirty sheets and the place smelled like horrible paint fumes. When I told the manager about the fumes-she could care less and told me that there was nothing she could do about the experience. She told me they just painted the day before and that it probably did not dry correctly. If that was the case they should have not rented the room out. I recieved my money back for the night with attitude! Needless to say I will not be staying there again....

Reviews.Title: “Great little place”
Reviews.Author: merhou
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend took me to Calisotga for my first Wine Country trip. The hotel needs a lot of updating, but it's comfortable and very clean. It's right off the main street in Calistoga so you can walk to everywhere. The hot springs pools are to die for! They offer mudbaths which I hear they are famous for, but unfortunately I didn't get one of those. The rooms are studios so you have a little kitchen if you need it. For as much activity goes on there - the pools are busy, there's not a lot of noise. Overall, I loved it there and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly, great pools-not so great spa service”
Reviews.Author: misssf
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the spa last year and I was surpised at the family friendly environment. Great for little kids, teens and family but if you are looking for romance and quiet, this is not the spa for you. People are outside your door until late at night carrying on and it is far from quiet. The pools make up for everything. ..4 of them at various temps and sizes. I had the mud bath treatment and since I visit Calistoga frequently, I have received treatments at other spas and would say that Calistoga Spa Hot Springs had the least attentive or interested staff. I wanted to book an extra night after arriving and they were completely full so it didn't work but the staff were so unfriendly (if not almost hostile) or at the very least completely disinterested in helping me or offering suggestions for other lodging. The rooms are simple but cozy and you will have full kitchen and it is fine if you are not picky and looking for glamour.

Reviews.Title: “Carlos why did you go?”
Reviews.Author: RolandoPaloAlto
Reviews.Content: I had been a frequent and happy guest. for many years. I would often bring family and friends. I really liked this place. Now it has a new manager. The new staff was extremely rude. I tried to communicate this to the manager and the owner, but never received a response form the owner, the manager defended her rude employee. Over the years many people came to this property because of my praise. I now regret this. It has become a more popular destination. I was made to feel, if not told in so many words that my business was not only not appreciated but not needed. Carlos the previous mjanager had a great feel for the HOSPITALITY BUSINESS. Ah well, I guess all good things come to an end.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Non-Snooty Oasis”
Reviews.Author: B_Pope
Reviews.Content: My company booked our room at Cal Spa for a Friday night in early December. I agree generally with the reviews I see here, but I rate the place higher than most reviewers. Here's why: Yes, it lacks the glitzyness normally associated with Napa Valley lodgings. The decor, while not offensive, is nothing special. But I think that's the charm of the place--it's friendly and homey, not pretentious and snooty. Our room was very clean, with a nice kitchenette and a great, large shower in the bathroom (two shower heads). The rooms face the inner courtyard which is pocked with little alcoves containing picnic tables and barbecues. The combination of kitchenette inside and pools and barbecue outside provides a family-friendly oasis in the Napa Valley. Unlike other NV lodgings, you could stay here and save a lot on food by preparing many meals yourself. Many restaurants and a grocery store are steps away. Pools were great in the evening. All employees we encountered were friendly. One quirk: Even though it was chilly outside, the room got quite hot, and we had to run the air conditioner. No problem, really, but we felt funny running the A/C in the winter. We enjoyed our stay--it was like a mini-retreat for us.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Hotelagent
Reviews.Content: I have been to this hotel over five times and am still very pleased with it. The moment you enter this hotel you feel as if you are in a spa. Yes, I will admitt that the lobby and rooms are outdated, but they are comfortable and pleasing to the eye. The pools are just wonderful. There are four pools-each one suiting a persons needs. There is also a pool bar where you can buy a bag of chips or water. The Rooms are quite large- each has a kitchen with small dining table. The bathrooms are clean and also quite large. There are plates, knives, and etc. in the kitchen as well. I love the outdoor hallways that lead to your rooms. They are filled with fragrant flowers and benches as well as barbeques that several people use in the evenings. The hotel has no restaurant but there are several wonderful ones two minutes away on the main road.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, no glitz, awesome mineral pools”
Reviews.Author: billsanders
Reviews.Content: On my third stay last May, I spent 11 nights at the Hot Springs. It's so convenient base to Napa via the back way on Silverado Trail. It's also an easy drive to Healdsburg in Sonoma through the Alexander Valley in Sonoma. It's motelish, but walking distance to wonderful restaurants, food markets, wine stores and other shopping. The mineral pools are heaven on earth. After dark take a bottle of wine to the upper pool deck and stare at the stars. The rooms are drab but it's still good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pools - Not so great rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although the pools were great, the room was shabby and ugly. Not very romantic. The TV was at least 30 years old, the towels thin and worn, and the decor very bad a70's style. Other than being old and outdated, the room was right by the street, and very noisy. For almost $200 a night, it was a rip-off. It's better to stay somewhere nice, and just come there for the use of the pools.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: TaskForceRanger
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the hotel. PLUSES: Friendly staff. The 4 Mineral pools were great. I loved the kiddie pool 1.5 feet high. Room and facility are very clean! The location is fantastic; the main street is literally just one block away from the hotel. We had lunch at the Palisades Market, their gourmet sandwiches are wonderful! Close to wineries. Having a kitchen is geat, though it would be nice if they have a microwave! Washer/dryer only 75cents a load. Pools open long hours from 8am-11pm. CONS: Dissappointed with the decor and style of the hotel when first arrived - 80's decor. A/C unit is loud! My mud bath experience was OK, expecting a little more pampering and refreshing.

Reviews.Title: “We always stay here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Walking distance from the shops, market, and dining establishments. Different pools for varied interests (kiddie wading pool, lap pool, warm "alzy swimmer" pool. Pleasant staff, clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've been going to The Calistoga Spa for 35 years now and it is wonderful. There are 3 pools, one for kiddies, one for laps, and one for soaking in minerals...but the 30' whirlpool is the best I've ever been in. It's gotten a bit pricy the last few years and reservations have to be made WAY ahead of time but I have never had a bad time there.

HotelInfo.Name: Calistoga Spa Hot Springs
HotelInfo.Address: 1006 Washington St., Calistoga, CA 94515
